my:Hazard.my:Description: Physical contact with razor blades / spikes.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Correct PPE must be worn at all times including face shield (visor), welding gauntlets and welding apron. b) All areas of the body must be covered to prevent lacerations.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Rigging overhead; loose blades falling onto face / eyes / head.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Correct PPE must be worn at all times including face shield (visor), welding gauntlets and welding apron. b) Face shield must always be in the correct position to ensure protection of the face. c) Hard hats must be worn and secured in place. d) When stretching upwards, arms must not become exposed. Ensure that boiler suit sleeves are long enough to maintain arm protection.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Rigging aloft from a ladder / falling / becoming entangled in razor wire.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) All persons involved must be wearing the correct PPE including face shield (visor), welding gauntlets and apron. b) Working aloft risk assessment and safe work permit must be completed in conjunction with this RAF and all required safety measures put into place c) One member of crew must always be footing the ladder d) One member of crew must be in control of the movement of razor wires/spikes e) Ensure that at any time the section of wire not being rigged is lead 'away' from the ladder. This will ensure minimal contact in the event of crew member falling.
